common Module¶

Created on Aug 5, 2012

@author: Gary

class housemonitor.lib.common.Common[source]¶

Bases: object

Common routines used through out House Monitor

static generateDevicePortTree(value, device, port, values)[source]¶

This function will create a values tree containing value.

Args: :param value: The number to add to the list of numbers. :type value: boolean, int or float :param device: the device. :type device: string :param device: the port. :type port: string :param values: a dictionary for storing the value value. :type port: dictionary :return: a boolean indicating if the entry is new

static getDeviceAndPort(data)[source]¶

Gets the device and port out of data dictionary

Parameters:data (dict) – The data that is passed into step.
Returns:device and port
Return type:string, string
Raises :KeyError 
>>> from steps.tmp36volts2centigrade import ConvertTMP36VoltsToCentigrade
>>> zig = ConvertTMP36VoltsToCentigrade()
>>> zig.getDeviceAndPort({'device': 'xyz', 'port': 'abc'})
'xyz', 'abc'
static send(value, data, listeners)[source]¶

Send takes the first listener off of the list listeners and sends the data to the next routine using the pubsub package.

Args:
value: the value to send to the next routine data: additional data do pass along listeners: a list of subscribers that will get the data

see special section that describe the listeners list

currentvalues Module¶

Created on Nov 7, 2012

@author: Gary

class housemonitor.lib.currentvalues.CurrentValues[source]¶

Bases: housemonitor.lib.base.Base

This module stores and returns the most resent data received from a device and port. It is primarily used for communicating the current value between threads.

buildDataBlock(value, data)[source]¶

Build a data block that is used to store the current values. The data that is stored in the data block is: 1. arrival time 2. Units 3. name 4. value

The index for each item is: Constants.DataPacket.arrival_time, Constants.DataPacket.units Constants.DataPacket.name, and Constants.DataPacket.current_value.

Parameters:
  • value (int, float, str) – the current value
  • data – the data that is pasted between steps
Returns:

dict containing the above items
Raises :

None
get()[source]¶

Get all the current values.

Thread safe

Returns:the current_value data
get_current_value(device, port)[source]¶

Get the current value given the device and port.

Parameters:
  • device (str) – The device
  • port (str) – The port
Returns:

dict containing the data for the selected item
logger_name[source]¶

Set the logger level.

store(value, device, port, data)[source]¶

Store the current data in the current value dictionary.

This module is thread safe.

Parameters:
  • device (str) – the device the data is coming from
  • port (str) – the port the data is coming from.
  • data (dict) – the port the data is coming from.
Raises :

None

Return a iso 8601 formatted string of the date/time

from lib.getdatetime import GetDateTime utc = GetDateTime() print(utc.isoformat())

time_format = '%Y/%m/%d %H:%M:%S'¶

Returns:time as formatted with time_format above
Return type:string in this format 1966:10:03 13:42:51

from lib.getdatetime import GetDateTime utc = GetDateTime() print(utc)

hmqueue Module¶

Created on 3/8/2013

@author: Gary

class housemonitor.lib.hmqueue.HMQueue[source]¶

Bases: lib.base.Base

QUEUE_SIZE = 100¶

The size of the Queue.

clear()[source]¶

Clear the queue

This routine is mainly used for unit test

>>> from lib.queue import HMQueue
>>> cosm = HMQueue()
>>> cosm.clean()

Warning

All the data in the queue will be lost

high_priority = 0¶
logger_name[source]¶

Set the logger level. This needs to be added to house_monitoring_logging.conf

low_priority = 8¶
mid_priority = 4¶
one_quarter_priority = 3¶
receive()[source]¶

Remove packet from input queue.

This routine will remove a packet from the COSM queue where it will be sent to COSM.

Returns packet:The same packet the was transmitted by the transmit function.
Return type:Same as the data that was sent by the transmit function
Exceptions :None

Warning

Will block if no packets are available

>>> from lib.queue import HMQueue
>>> cosm = HMQueue()
>>> cosm.transmit({'a':  'b'})
>>> cosm.receive()
{'a': 'b'}
three_quarters_priority = 2¶
transmit(packet, priority=4)[source]¶

Add packet to input queue.

This is the cosm queue that all outgoing messages will go though. messages are added on the processing side and then passed to the thread where the data will be sent to COSM.

Parameters:packet – a data packet with the data to be processed
Returns:none
Exceptions :none 
>>> from lib.queue import HMQueue
>>> cosm = HMQueue()
>>> cosm.transmit({'a':  'b'})
>>> cosm.receive()
{'a': 'b'}

Warning

This my block if gueue is full. The attribute QUEUE_SIZE contains the number of items that can be put on the queue.

hmscheduler Module¶

Created on 2012-11-18

@author: Gary

class housemonitor.lib.hmscheduler.HMScheduler(queue)[source]¶

Bases: lib.base.Base

The HMSceduler is used to periodically to send messages to HouseMonitor. The commands can anything including:

# Report status # Turn on and off devices.

You control the scheduler by sending messages to the scheduler using pubsub.

add_cron(name, year=None, month=None, day=None, week=None, day_of_week=None, hour=None, minute=None, second=None, start_date=None, args=None, kwargs=None)[source]¶

Schedule a cron command to call sendCommand.

For more information on the parameter see:

See also

http://packages.python.org/APScheduler/cronschedule.html

Parameters:
  • name – the name of the cron job to start. This will be used to identify the job if there is a need to delete it latter.
  • weeks (int) – the number of weeks between calls.
  • days (int) – the number of days between calls.
  • hours (int) – the number of hours between calls.
  • minutes (int) – the number of minutes between calls.
  • seconds (int) – the number of seconds between calls.
  • start_date (datetime) – the time and date to start the interval.
  • args – the args to pass to sendCommand
  • kwargs – the kwargs to pass to sendCommand
Raises :

None
add_date(name, date, args=None, kwargs=None)[source]¶

Schedule a specific data and time to call sendCommand.

For more information on the parameter see:

See also

http://packages.python.org/APScheduler/dateschedule.html

Parameters:
  • name – the name of the cron job to start. This will be used to identify the job if there is a need to delete it latter.
  • date (dictionary) – Set the time to call sendCommand
  • args – the arguments to call sendCommand with
  • date – the kwwargs to call sendCommand with
add_interval(name, weeks=0, days=0, hours=0, minutes=0, seconds=0, start_date=None, args=None, kwargs=None)[source]¶

Schedule an interval at which sendCommand will be called.

For more information on the parameter see:

See also

http://packages.python.org/APScheduler/intervalschedule.html

Parameters:
  • name (str) – the name of the job to start. This will be used to identify the job if there is a need to delete it latter.
  • weeks (int) – the number of weeks between calls.
  • days (int) – the number of days between calls.
  • hours (int) – the number of hours between calls.
  • minutes (int) – the number of minutes between calls.
  • seconds (int) – the number of seconds between calls.
  • start_date (datetime) – the time and date to start the interval.
  • args – the args to pass to sendCommand
  • kwargs – the kwargs to pass to sendCommand
Raises :

None
add_one_shot(name, delta, args=None, kwargs=None)[source]¶

Schedule sendCommand to be called after some interval. (ie. in 5 seconds or one hour). For more information on timeDelta see:

See also

http://docs.python.org/2/library/datetime.html#timedelta-objects

Parameters:
  • name – delta the time until sendCommand is called
  • date (dictionary) – Set the time to call sendCommand
  • args – the arguments to call sendCommand with
  • date – the kwwargs to call sendCommand with
deleteJob(name)[source]¶

Delete a specified job

Parameters:name – the name of the job to delete.
jobs = defaultdict(<type 'list'>, {})¶

scheduler = None¶

scheduler_topic_name[source]¶

The topic name to which this routine subscribes.

sendCommand(device, port, listeners=[], scheduler_id=UUID('71eb1e11-c085-4731-aadd-cee4c95c5457'))[source]¶

send command will send the cammand to the HouseMonitor system

Parameters:
  • device (str) – the device name.
  • port – the port name.
  • listeners (list of strings that contains the topic name of the listeners. Most can be found in Constants.TopicNames) – the listeners that this command will be routed to.
shutdown(wait=True)[source]¶

shutdown the scheduler

Parameters:wait (boolean) – determines whether to wait on threads to commplete.

For more information on the parameter see:

See also

http://packages.python.org/APScheduler/#starting-the-scheduler

send command will send the cammand to the HouseMonitor system

  • device (str) – the device name.
  • port – the port name.
  • listeners (list of strings that contains the topic name of the listeners. Most can be found in Constants.TopicNames) – the listeners that this command will be routed to.
